17.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.

18.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

18.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
18.str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

18.word: [ a mountain that ] can be touched
18.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Singular
18.str2: From the base of psallo; to manipulate, i.e. Verify by contact; figuratively, to search for.

18.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Singular
18.str2: To ignite, light, burn, lit. and met; I consume with fire. Apparently a primary verb; to set on fire, i.e. Kindle or consume.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
Darkness, gloom; a thick cloud. Akin to nephos; gloom.
Darkness, murkiness, gloom. Akin to the base of nephos; gloom.
A storm, tempest, whirlwind. From thuo a storm.

19.str2: A trumpet, the sound of a trumpet. Perhaps from salos; a trumpet.
(a) a sound, noise, (b) a rumor, report. Of uncertain affinity; a loud or confused noise, i.e. Roar; figuratively, a rumor.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

19.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular

19.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

19.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

19.str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
To place (put) to, add; I do again. From pros and tithemi; to place additionally, i.e. Lay beside, annex, repeat.

20.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

And if, even if, even, at least. From kai and ean; and if.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: A prolonged form of an obsolete primary thigo; to manipulate, i.e. Have to do with; by implication, to injure.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

20.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: To stone, cast stones (at), kill by stoning. From a compound of lithos and ballo; to throw stones, i.e. Lapidate.

21.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

21.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
21.str2: To cause to appear, make visible. From a derivative of phaino; to make apparent, i.e. to appear.

21.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Fearful, dreadful, terrible. From phobos; frightful, i.e. formidable.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

21.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

Greatly terrified, horrified. From ek and phobos; frightened out of one's wits: sore afraid, exceedingly fear.

22.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

22.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural

Zion, the hill; used for Jerusalem or heaven. Of Hebrew origin; Sion, a hill of Jerusalem; figuratively, the Church.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

22.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
22.str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

From epi and ouranos; above the sky.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
A myriad, group of ten thousand, a ten thousand. From murioi; a ten-thousand; by extension, a 'myriad' or indefinite number.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

23.str2: A festival assembly. From pas and a derivative of agora; a mass-meeting, i.e. universal companionship.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
First-born, eldest. From protos and the alternate of tikto; first-born.

23.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
23.str2: From apo and grapho; to write off, i.e. Enrol.

A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A judge, magistrate, ruler. From krino; a judge.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

23.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
23.str2: From teleios; to complete, i.e. accomplish, or consummate.

From mesos; a go-between, i.e. an internunciator, or a reconciler.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.

No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
